The pathological staging is classified as pT2c, indicating that the tumor involves both lobes of the prostate.

The pathology report confirms a diagnosis of infiltrative duct carcinoma in the left breast, measuring 2.4 cm, with a Bloom-Richardson grade of III. Surgical margins are free of tumor, with the closest margin being 0.2 cm from the tumor, and all sentinel lymph nodes examined are negative for malignancy. The overall classification is PTNM T2, N0, MX, indicating stage IIA breast cancer.

The pathology report indicates that the excised lymph nodes (Level 4R, Level 7, and Level 4L) are negative for tumor involvement. The right upper lobe lobectomy revealed a moderately differentiated non-keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma measuring 5.1 x 4.2 cm, with negative bronchial margins and no lymph node involvement. Additional findings include subpleural fibrosis and ossification, with no evidence of angiolymphatic invasion or satellite tumors.

The pathology report indicates the presence of multifocal papillary thyroid carcinoma in the left lobe of the thyroid gland, measuring 3.0 cm, with no tumor found in the examined lymph nodes from both the right neck (11 nodes) and left neck (8 nodes). An amendment corrected the diagnosis of a lymph node from "thymoma" to "psammoma," with no metastatic carcinoma identified in the additional levels reviewed. The report confirms the presence of adenomatous nodules and parathyroid tissue, with the overall diagnosis remaining unchanged.

The pathology report indicates the presence of esophagogastric adenocarcinoma, grade 2, with the larger tumor measuring 3.7 cm and invading through the muscularis propria into periesophageal soft tissue, while the proximal and distal margins are free of tumor. Additionally, a separate gastric adenocarcinoma, also grade 2, measures 2.2 cm and invades the adventitia, with negative margins as well. Two out of seven examined lymph nodes show metastatic adenocarcinoma, leading to a pathologic staging of mpT3N1G2.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of invasive lobular carcinoma and lobular carcinoma in situ in the right breast, following a simple mastectomy. The tumor measures 1.6 cm and shows moderate nuclear atypia with estrogen receptors present in 75% of the neoplastic cells, while progesterone receptors are found in 10-75%. Immunohistochemical analysis reveals a negative HER2 status and a Ki-67 proliferation index of 10%.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of right renal cell carcinoma, conventional (clear cell) type, with massive necrosis, calcifications, and focal sarcomatoid changes, specifically rhabdoid morphology, with a Fuhrman nuclear grade of IV. The tumor measures 8.0 cm and shows extension into the renal sinus fat and involvement of the renal vein margin, with evidence of tumor thrombus present. Additional findings include focal global glomerulosclerosis and prominent lymphocytic interstitial infiltrate in the non-neoplastic kidney, with a pathological staging of pT3b.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of Grade 3 squamous cell carcinoma in the left upper lobe of the lung, characterized by a 2.0 x 1.8 x 1.8 cm mass associated with usual interstitial pneumonia. The tumor has invaded the visceral pleura and is completely excised, with margins extending within 1 millimeter of the stapled surgical margin. Examination of multiple superior and inferior mediastinal lymph nodes shows no evidence of tumor involvement.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of low-grade oligodendroglioma (WHO grade II) in a right frontal brain mass, characterized by focal increased cellularity and mild mitotic activity. Immunohistochemical analysis shows positivity for IDH1(R132H) mutation, rare p53 expression, and variable Ki-67 labeling, supporting the diagnosis. Further fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) studies for 1p19q deletion are pending for additional evaluation.

The pathology report indicates that the right renal mass was diagnosed as renal cell carcinoma, papillary type 2, with a Fuhrman nuclear grade of 3 out of 4, measuring 4.0 cm. All margins from the partial nephrectomy, including peritumoral fat and various renal mass margins, were negative for carcinoma, indicating no invasion beyond the tumor. The pathological stage is classified as pT1aNXMx, and there is mild chronic inflammation and focal glomerulosclerosis noted in the non-neoplastic kidney.

The pathology report indicates a left upper lobectomy revealing a moderately to poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma measuring 63 mm, with no evidence of pleural, vascular, lymphatic, or perineural invasion. The bronchial resection margin shows squamous metaplasia but is clear of malignancy, while metastasis is identified in the No. 6 lymph node. The pathological stage is classified as T2N2.

The pathology report indicates that the right and left pelvic lymph nodes were resected, with all nine right lymph nodes and four left lymph nodes showing no evidence of metastases. The prostate specimen revealed prostatic adenocarcinoma with a Gleason score of 4+5, involving approximately 30% of the prostate volume and showing focal periprostatic involvement, but no tumor was found in the seminal vesicles or vas deferens. Surgical resection margins were negative for tumor, and the pathological staging is classified as T3a.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of poorly differentiated high-grade serous carcinoma originating from the left ovary, with metastases identified in the left fallopian tube, anterior rectal wall, omentum, spleen, right ovary, and multiple lymph nodes. The tumor measures 6.0 cm in the left ovary and 16.0 cm in the omentum, with a FIGO stage of IV and TNM stage of pT3cN1M1. Additional specimens, including biopsies from various sites, confirmed the presence of metastatic serous carcinoma in multiple locations, while some specimens showed no significant pathologic abnormalities.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of moderately differentiated colorectal adenocarcinoma located in the cecum, measuring 5.5 cm in diameter and exhibiting invasive growth into the intestinal walls and surrounding fatty tissue. The resection margins are clear of tumor, and all 21 examined lymph nodes are free of cancer, showing only reactive changes. The tumor is staged as pT3, pNO (0/21), LO, V0; G2.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of invasive moderately differentiated colonic adenocarcinoma in a segment of the sigmoid colon, with the tumor extending through the muscularis propria to the junction with the serosa. The surgical margins (proximal, distal, and radial) are free of tumor, and eleven examined mesenteric lymph nodes show no evidence of metastatic carcinoma. Overall, the findings suggest localized disease without lymphatic spread.

The pathology report indicates a partial resection of the transverse colon revealing a moderately to poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with a histopathological differentiation grade of G2-3. The tumor shows erosions on the inner surface, evidence of carcinomatous lymphangitis, and infiltration into the muscularis layer of the colon wall, but no tumor was found in the examined lymph nodes (0/15). The tumor is classified as pT2, pNO (015), Mx, L1, R0, with a diagnosis code of ICDO-DA-M 8140/3.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of dedifferentiated liposarcoma arising from a well-differentiated liposarcoma in the right retroperitoneum, with the dedifferentiated component comprising over 98% of the mass and showing high-grade spindle and pleomorphic characteristics. The tumor, measuring 10.8 cm, involves the colonic wall and exhibits necrosis, while a separate well-differentiated liposarcoma measuring 6 cm is also present, affecting the spermatic cord. Surgical resection margins are uninvolved, and immunohistochemical stains for CDK4 and MDM2 are positive in the tumor cells.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of renal cell carcinoma with Xp11.2 translocation in the right kidney, characterized by a large tumor measuring 17.0 cm and showing necrosis, but without lymphovascular invasion. The adrenal gland shows focal cortical nodular hyperplasia, and the paracaval lymph node and hernia sac specimens reveal no evidence of tumor. Cytogenetic analysis confirms an abnormal karyotype with a balanced translocation involving chromosomes X and 1, associated with the development of renal cell carcinoma.

The pathology report indicates the presence of metastatic carcinoma in one of fifteen right pelvic lymph nodes, while three left pelvic lymph nodes show no evidence of neoplasia. A radical prostatectomy reveals invasive poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with a Gleason score of 8, involving both lobes of the prostate and showing established extracapsular extension, with involvement of the left seminal vesicle. The surgical margins are free of carcinoma, and perineural invasion is noted, with a pathologic TNM stage of pT3b N1 MX.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of glioblastoma multiforme (WHO Grade IV) in the left frontal lobe of the brain, confirmed by multiple biopsy specimens. Additional findings include infiltrating gliomas demonstrating both oligodendroglial and astrocytic differentiation, along with chromosomal losses in 1p and 19q. The report includes various specimens labeled as "permanent edge," "permanent core," and "permanent white matter," all consistent with malignant glioma.

The pathology report indicates a diagnosis of poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma in the right upper lobe of the lung, measuring 3.5 cm, with uninvolved surgical margins and no evidence of metastasis in five examined lymph nodes. Additional lymph node resections (R4 and Level VII) also showed no evidence of metastasis. Overall, the findings suggest a localized tumor without regional or distant spread at the time of evaluation.
